intro: Satureja panicera, commonly known as panicled savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its small, pink to purple flowers are arranged in paniculate inflorescences, giving it its common name. Satureja panicera is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
